question: Which element is considered part of the network layer of network security?
options: Locks on the data centre doors
Keeping operating systems up to date with patches
Separate servers into distinct subnets by role
correctAnswer: Separate servers into distinct subnets by role

question: What is meant by a shared model in Azure?
options: Azure takes care of security completely
You must keep your security keys private and ensure they don't get out
Both users and Azure have responsibilities for security
Azure takes no responsibility for security
correctAnswer: Both users and Azure have responsibilities for security

question: What is the recommended way within Azure to store secrets such as private cryptographic keys?
options: In an Azure Storage account private blob container

question: Which Azure service is meant to be a security dashboard that contains all the security and threat protection in one place?
Who is responsible for the security of the physical servers in an Azure data centre?
options: I am responsible for securing the phyiscal data centres
Azure is responsible for securing the physical data centres
correctAnswer: Azure is responsible for securing the physical data centres

question: Who is responsible for the security of your Azure Storage account access keys?
options: I am responsible for securing the access keys
Azure is responsible for securing the access keys
correctAnswer: I am responsible for securing the access keys

question: Which element is considered part of the perimeter layer of network security?
options: Locks on the data centre doors
Separate servers into distinct subnets by role
Keep operating systems up to date with patches

question: Windows servers use remote desktop protocol (RDP) in order for administrators to get access to manage the server. Linux servers use SSH. What is the recommendation for ensuring the security of these protocols?
options: Ensure strong passwords on your Windows admin accounts
Do not enable SSH access for Linux servers
Disable RDP access using the Windows Services control panel admin tool
Do not allow public Internet access over the RDP and SSH ports directly to the server
correctAnswer: Do not allow public Internet access over the RDP and SSH ports directly to the server

question: What is one of the three core principles of the Zero Trust model of security?
options: Use a firewall on the network perimeter
Always encrypt data stored on the hard disk

question: _______ is the strategy of layering multiple security defenses on top of each other to provide stronger protection than any single defensive mechanism alone.
In what way does multi-factor authentication (MFA) increase the security of a user account?
options: It requires users to be approved before they can log in for the first time
It doesn't, multi-factor authentication is more about access and authentication than account security
It requires the user to possess something like their phone to read an SMS, use a mobile app, or biometric identification
correctAnswer: It requires the user to possess something like their phone to read an SMS, use a mobile app, or biometric identification

question: Select all features which are part of Azure AD.
What software is used to synchronise your on-premises AD with your Azure AD?
Which Azure service can enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for administrators, but not require it for regular users?
Through Azure AD, one can control access to an application but not the resources of the application.
How does multi-factor authentication (MFA) make a system more secure?
options: It requires the user to have access to their verified phone in order to log in
It allows the user to log in without a password because they have already previously been validated using a browser cookie
It doesn't make it more secure
It is another password that a user has to memorise, making it more secure
correctAnswer: It requires the user to have access to their verified phone in order to log in

question: Azure Tenant is a dedicated and trusted instance of Azure Active Directory that's automatically created when your organisation signs up for a Microsoft cloud service subscription.
Which Azure governance tool allows you to implement compliance audits to find instances of Azure resources that do not follow the company policy, or even prevent those resources from being created?
How do you control the traffic flowing between two subnets on the same virtual network?
_______ is a service that offers a Windows 10 or Windows 11 virtual machine that runs in the cloud for use as your workstation.
Which is a feature of the cool access tier for Azure Storage?
options: Significant delays in accessing your data, up to several hours
Most expensive option when it comes to bandwidth cost to access your files
Much cheaper to store your files than the hot access tier
Cheapest option when it comes to bandwidth costs to access your files
correctAnswer: Much cheaper to store your files than the hot access tier

question: What is the minimum charge for having an Azure account each month, even if you don't use any resources?
With Azure public cloud, anyone with a valid credit card can sign up and get services immediately, subject to geography restrictions.
Azure is a public cloud, and has no private cloud offerings.

If you wanted to simply use Azure as an extension of your own datacenter, not primarily hosting anything there but using it for extra storage or taking advantage of some services, what hosting model is that called?
What is the concept of paired regions?
options: Each region of the world has one other region, usually in a completely separate country and geography, where it makes the most sense to place your backups
Azure employees in those regions sometimes go on picnics together

Each region in the world has at least one other region with which it shares an extremely high speed connection, and where there is co-ordinated action by Azure not to do anything that will bring them both down at the same time
When you deploy your code to one region of the world, it is automatically deployed to the paired region as an emergency backup
correctAnswer: Each region in the world has at least one other region with which it shares an extremely high speed connection, and where there is co-ordinated action by Azure not to do anything that will bring them both down at the same time

question: Which of the following is a good example of a hybrid cloud?
options: Your code is a mobile app that runs on iOS and Android phones, but it uses a database in the cloud
Technology that allows you to grow living tissue on top of an exoskeleton, making Terminators impossible to spot among humans
A server runs in your own environment, but places files in the cloud so that it can extend the amount of storage it has access to
Your users are inside your corporate network but your applications and data are in the cloud
correctAnswer: A server runs in your own environment, but places files in the cloud so that it can extend the amount of storage it has access to

question: Which is an advantage of running your cloud in a private cloud?
options: You own the hardware, so you can change private cloud hosting providers easily
Assurance that your code, data and applications are running on isolated hardware, and on an isolated network
Private cloud is significantly cheaper than the public cloud
correctAnswer: Assurance that your code, data and applications are running on isolated hardware, and on an isolated network

question: The _______ model of cloud computing mixes resources in the Azure cloud with resources in your own data centre.
Each person has their own user ID and password to log into Azure, but how many subscriptions can a single account be associated with?
What would be a good reason to have multiple Azure subscriptions?
options: There is one person/credit card paying for resources, but many people who have accounts in Azure, and you need to separate out resources between clients so that there is absolutely no chance of resources being exposed between them

There is one person/credit card paying for resources, and only one person who logs into Azure to manage the resources, but you want to be able to know which resources are used for which client project
correctAnswer: There is one person/credit card paying for resources, but many people who have accounts in Azure, and you need to separate out resources between clients so that there is absolutely no chance of resources being exposed between them

question: What is an Azure subscription?
options: It is the level at which services are billed. All resources created under a subscription are billed to that subscription
Each user account is associated with a unique subscription. If you need more than one subscription, you need to create multiple user accounts
correctAnswer: It is the level at which services are billed. All resources created under a subscription are billed to that subscription

question: What type of resources are defined as compute resources?
options: Resources that perform some type of task that requires CPU cycles to perform the work
All resources that are lsited in the Azure Marketplace
correctAnswer: Resources that perform some type of task that requires CPU cycles to perform the work

question: Which Azure feature is specifically designed to help companies get their in-house developed code from the code repository, through automated unit testing, and onto Azure using a service called Pipelines?
Which of the following is not a feature of Azure Functions?
options: Designed for backend batch applications that are continuously running
Can trigger the function based off of Azure events such as a new file being saved to a storage account blob container
Can edit the code right in the Azure Portal using a code editor
Can possibly cost you nothing as there is a generous free tier
correctAnswer: Designed for backend batch applications that are continuously running

question: Which database product offers sub 5 millisecond response times as a feature?
What hardware device is required to exist or be installed on your company network in order to set up a site-to-site VPN?
What is the most number of virtual machines that can be managed under a single Virtual Machine Scale Set?
What benefit does a Content Delivery Network (CDN) provide its users?
options: For a small fee, Azure will take over management of your virtual machine, perform OS updates and ensure it's running well
Allows you to store data that can be retrieved later in an extremely fast and inexpensive manner
Allows you to reduce the traffic coming into a web server for static, unchanging files such as images, videos and PDFs
Allows you to temporarily keep session information on the web visitor such as their login ID or their name
correctAnswer: Allows you to reduce the traffic coming into a web server for static, unchanging files such as images, videos and PDFs

question: What Azure product allows you to autoscale virtual machines from 1 to 1000 instances, and also provides load balancing services built in?
Which of the following resources are not considered compute resources?
Which two features does Virtual Machine Scale Sets provide as part of the core product?
options: Automatic installation of supporting apps and deployment of custom code

question: What advantage does an Application Gateway have over a Load Balancer?
options: Application Gateway can be scaled so that two, three or more instances of the gateway can support your application
Application Gateway is more like an enterprise-grade product. You should not use a load balancer in production
Application Gateway understands the HTTP protocol and can interpret the URL and make decisions based on the URL
correctAnswer: Application Gateway understands the HTTP protocol and can interpret the URL and make decisions based on the URL

question: Which operating systems do Azure Virtual Machines support?
Which of the following is something that Azure Cognitive Services API can currently do?
options: Translate text from one language to another
Speak text in an extremely realistic way
All of these! Azure can do it all!
correctAnswer: All of these! Azure can do it all!

question: Which Azure Service contains pre-built machine learning models that you can use in your own code, using an API?
What is the concept of Big Data?
options: A form of artificial intelligence (AI) that allows systems to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed
A small sensor or other device that constantly sends its status and other data to the cloud
An extremely large set of data that you want to ingest and do analysis on; traditional software like SQL Server cannot handle Big Data as efficiently as specialised products
A set of Azure services that allow you to use execute code in the cloud but don't require (or even allow) you to manage the underlying server
correctAnswer: An extremely large set of data that you want to ingest and do analysis on; traditional software like SQL Server cannot handle Big Data as efficiently as specialised products

question: Where do you go within the Azure Portal to find all of the third-party virtual machine and other offers?
options: Choose an image when creating a VM

question: What database service is specifically designed to be extremely fast in responding to requests for small amounts of data (called low latency)?
What is the name of the collective set of APIs that provide machine learning and artificial intelligence services to your own applications like voice recognition, image tagging, and chat bot?
